They are typically found on rocks, soil, or bark in temperate and boreal regions. Thylacospermum species are known for their ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions, including drought and extreme temperatures. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in ecological studies due to their sensitivity to air pollution.
